page.title: 15Local History/ Darras Hall
page.content: {"The Railway Line" } Early this century,when the {Darras Hall Estate}was established, a railway line was planned to cater for the new estate. The line opened for passenger traffic to{Darras Hall } station in{1913}with provision for an extension to the western edge of the estate. A line was built to a small coal mine at{Kirkheaton}but when operations there ceased the track was removed. In 1921{Newcastle}Corporation provided a motor bus service to the estate and by 1929 the railway line ceased to operate for passenger traffic.The station building,a wooden construction, is still to be seen in Darras Hall.From 1963-1973 it was used as a church until a new United Reformed Church was built nearby.It is still in use by playgroups,Brownies.
